title: The Trial
author: Franz Kafka
description: A surreal and haunting tale of a man arrested by an invisible authority for an unknown crime.

title: Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: Gregor Samsa wakes up to find himself transformed into a giant insect in this dark allegorical masterpiece.

title: Man’s Search for Meaning
author: Viktor E. Frankl
description: A Holocaust survivor’s reflection on life, suffering, and the will to find meaning.

title: A Little Life
author: Hanya Yanagihara
description: An emotionally devastating portrait of trauma, friendship, and resilience among four college friends.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Narrated by Death, this WWII-era story follows a young girl who steals books and shares them with others.

title: All the Light We Cannot See
author: Anthony Doerr
description: The lives of a blind French girl and a German boy collide during WWII in this Pulitzer-winning novel.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: A magical circus that opens only at night becomes the stage for a duel between two young magicians.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A nostalgic and melancholic story of love and loss in 1960s Tokyo.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The Buendía family saga unfolds over generations in the mythical town of Macondo.

title: Kafka on the Shore
author: Haruki Murakami
description: A metaphysical journey through dreams, fate, and memory — full of talking cats and surreal events.
